misconceptions.name: Confusing input size (n) with input values
misconceptions.desc: Student thinks Big-O depends on the actual numbers in the data, not the number of items n.

misconceptions.name: Constants matter in Big-O
misconceptions.desc: Student thinks O(2n) is different from O(n) in Big-O terms because of the constant factor.

misconceptions.name: Doesn't understand halving implies log n
misconceptions.desc: Student treats repeated halving as linear or does not connect divide-by-2 steps to logarithmic growth.

misconceptions.name: Mixes up best-case and worst-case
misconceptions.desc: Student gives best-case or average-case when the question expects worst-case (or vice versa).

diagnostic.question: What is the time complexity of a loop over n items?
What is the complexity of halving n each step? (Example: i = n; while i>1: i = i/2)
